title: The chemicals released due to unsustainable agricultural practices and causing soil polluiton are

tasks.task: Jumping over a rut or pothole in a field
subtasks: Approach the field in a four-wheel drive vehicle
Identify the rut or pothole in the field
Position the vehicle close to the rut
Apply pressure and use legs to jump the vehicle over the rut
Ensure proper alignment and control during the jump

tasks.task: Checking for proper oil level in the four-wheel drive vehicle
subtasks: Open the hood of the vehicle
Locate the oil reservoir or dipstick
Remove the dipstick and wipe it clean
Reinsert the dipstick and pull it out again to check the oil level
Compare the oil level to the minimum and maximum marks on the dipstick
If oil is low, stop and top up the oil reservoir

tasks.task: Operating the four-wheel drive vehicle in the field
subtasks: Start the vehicle and ensure it is operational
Check all controls and gauges before driving
Navigate through the field, paying attention to obstacles like ruts or hills
Use steering wheel to maneuver the vehicle around obstructions
Apply brakes when necessary to stop the vehicle safely
Shift gears appropriately while driving.

tasks.task: Stopping the four-wheel drive vehicle
subtasks: Apply brakes to slow down approaching the stopping point
Gradually reduce speed until coming to a complete stop
Use handbrake if necessary to maintain parking position
Turn off the engine once the vehicle has stopped
Secure any cargo or tools in the vehicle

tasks.task: Placing a voltmeter to check battery voltage
subtasks: Locate the vehicle's battery
Identify the positive (+) and negative (-) terminals of the battery
Connect the voltmeter to the battery terminals, ensuring proper polarity
Note the voltage reading from the voltmeter
Compare the voltage to the expected range and make adjustments if necessary (e.g., charging the battery if voltage is low)

tasks.task: Shifting the transmission from 4Lo to 4High
subtasks: Find the transmission control lever in the vehicle's cab
Look for options labeled 4Lo, 4High, or similar
Move the lever to the 4High position
Confirm that the vehicle's speedometer reflects higher speeds when in 4High compared to 4Lo

tasks.task: Operating the push-park mechanism of the four-wheel drive vehicle
subtasks: Transition from 4High to reverse gear (Rev)
Use the push-park lever to move into reverse position
Check mirrors and surroundings before reversing
Slowly reverse the vehicle using the steering wheel and brakes as needed
Engage forward gears (4High) and use the push-park mechanism to go forward

tasks.task: Lifting a test device for voltage measurement
subtasks: Pick up the test device with one hand
Hold the device steady while checking voltage
Ensure the device is properly connected for accurate readings

tasks.task: Walking back to the vehicle
subtasks: Exit the field
Walk towards the vehicle's location
Approach cautiously, avoiding any tripping hazards

tasks.task: Maneuvering the four-wheel drive vehicle on bumpy terrain
subtasks: Drive slowly over uneven surfaces
Use steering input and slight movements to maintain balance
Watch for any signs of strain or difficulty in the vehicle's operation as it negotiates the terrain.

tasks.task: Checking the tires for proper air pressure
subtasks: Find the tire pressure gauge or pump
Locate the valve stem on the tire
Press the gauge onto the valve stem to check pressure
Compare the current pressure to the recommended pressure (e.g., from the vehicle's manual)
Inflate the tires as needed using the pump/pressure gauge.

tasks.task: Taking a break during field work
subtasks: Exit the vehicle if space allows or wait outside the vehicle
Stretch legs and back
Hydrate with water or other refreshment

tasks.task: Using a hammer to test a part of the vehicle
subtasks: Find an appropriate testing point on the vehicle
Apply the hammer gently to the area to check for stability or resonance
Evaluate the sound or vibration produced to determine part condition.
